Design.Theme;Desc:
UI Theme
(Theme changes will be applied when the application is restarted.)

General.EAapp_Config_Folder_Path;Desc:
Folder where EA app config files are stored
If you enter a blank or nonexistent folder, it will be retrieved automatically.
*Normally, we recommend leaving this field blank.
General.EAapp_Config_File_Name;Desc:
File name of EA app config file
This field is required if the platform you are playing on is the EA app.
*This config file is different for each account, so if you play with multiple accounts,
you will need to rename the file each time you switch accounts.

Update.CheckForUpdatesOnAppLaunch;Name: Check for updates when launching the application
Update.CheckForUpdatesOnAppLaunch;Desc: Whether or not to automatically check for updates when the application is launched
Update.ReleaseChannel;Desc: Release channel of the version to be installed when updating

UI_MainMenu.News_Language;Desc: Languages of news displayed in the main menu
UI_MainMenu.ServerStatus_Region;Desc: Server status regions displayed in the main menu
UI_MainMenu.ServerStatus_Region;List: Asia,EU East,EU West,US South,US Central,US East,US West

-eac_launcher_settings.Desc:
Launch your game with DirectX 12.
Using DirectX 12 allows the game to distribute the CPU graphics code across multiple cores, which can result in higher frame rates.
In some environments, this may cause problems, such as textures not displaying properly.
-eac_launcher_settings.Name: Enable DirectX 12 (Beta)

-forcenovsync.Desc: Forces the V-SYNC to be disabled.
-forcenovsync.Name: Force Disable V-SYNC

-fullscreen.Desc: Start the game with the window in full screen.
-fullscreen.Name: Fullscreen

-high.Desc:
Change the CPU priority of Apex Legends to "High".
Changing this may lead to performance improvements, though,
Apex Legends CPU usage will increase and may cause system and other applications to become unstable.
-high.Name: Change priority to "high"

-limitvsconst.Desc: Change the number of vertex shaders to 256. Changes may lead to better performance.
-limitvsconst.Name: Change the number of vertex shaders

-noff.Desc:
Disables the vibration function of the controller in the game. The vibration function will no longer function in-game.
Disabling it may lead to improved performance.
-noff.Name: Disable Vibration Function

-nojoy.Desc:
Disables the joystick function of the controller. You will no longer be able to use the joystick in-game.
Disabling it may lead to improved performance.
-nojoy.Name: Disable Joystick Function

-nomouse.Desc:
Disables mouse functionality. You will not be able to use the mouse in the game.
Disabling it may lead to improved performance.
-nomouse.Name: Disable Mouse Function

-novid.Desc: Disables EA's unique explosive splash movie, reducing startup time and preventing eardrum damage.
-novid.Name: Disable Splash Movie

-preload.Desc:
Priority is given to loading the necessary data at game startup.
This may lead to improved performance when playing, but may increase RAM usage and increase loading time.
-preload.Name: Prioritize reading necessary data at startup

-refresh.Choices: Specified Input,60 Hz,95 Hz,120 Hz,144 Hz,240 Hz,360 Hz
-refresh.Desc: Sets the upper limit of the refresh rate.
-refresh.Name: Refresh rate upper limit

-threads.Desc:
Change the number of CPU threads used by Apex Legends.
Normally, Apex Legends automatically uses all threads, so no configuration is required.
Change this setting if you want to limit the number of threads Apex Legends uses.
-threads.Name: Change number of threads

+building_cubemaps.Desc: This argument is automatically enabled when resolution changing is enabled.
+building_cubemaps.Name: Only for resolution change setting | +building_cubemaps

+cl_forcepreload.Desc:
Pre-load data such as maps and sounds required for play.
This may lead to better performance when playing, but may increase RAM usage and increase load times.
+cl_forcepreload.Name: Pre-load the data necessary for play

+cl_liveapi_allow_requests.Desc: Allows processing and execution of incoming requests.
+cl_liveapi_allow_requests.Name: Allow processing and execution of incoming requests

+cl_liveapi_pretty_print_log.Desc: Formats the JSON output to be more human readable.
+cl_liveapi_pretty_print_log.Name: Pretty JSON output

+cl_liveapi_use_protobuf.Desc:
When enabled, uses protobuf as serialization format.
When disabled, uses JSON as the serialization format.
+cl_liveapi_use_protobuf.Name: Use protobuf as serialization format

+cl_liveapi_ws_keepalive.Desc: Specifies the interval at which to ping any connected server.
+cl_liveapi_ws_keepalive.Name: WebSocket | Keepalive interval

+cl_liveapi_ws_retry_count.Desc: Specifies the number of retries before failing to connect.
+cl_liveapi_ws_retry_count.Name: WebSocket | Number of retries

+cl_liveapi_ws_retry_time.Desc: Specifies the time (in seconds) before retrying.
+cl_liveapi_ws_retry_time.Name: WebSocket | Retry time

+cl_liveapi_ws_servers.Desc:
Specifies a WebSocket server.
If you specify more than one, separate them with ",".
+cl_liveapi_ws_servers.Name: WebSocket | Server list

+cl_ragdoll_collide.Desc: Change the physical behavior of dead bodies and other objects. Changes may lead to improved performance.
+cl_ragdoll_collide.Name: Change physics behavior

+cl_showfps.Desc:
Enables the overlay display of performance information such as ping for FPS and servers.
This setting is similar to the "Performance Display" setting in the in-game settings.
+cl_showfps.Name: Enable performance information overlay display

+cl_showpos.Desc: Enable overlay display of information such as username, position coordinates, and movement speed.
+cl_showpos.Name: Enable player info overlay

+exec.Desc:
Load the autoexec file and apply the config when the game starts.
autoexec can be edited from the "Autoexec" tab.
+exec.Name: Load autoexec

+fps_max.Choices: Unlimited,Specified Input,60 FPS,95 FPS,120 FPS,144 FPS,240 FPS,360 FPS
+fps_max.Desc: Set the upper limit of FPS.
+fps_max.Name: FPS upper limit

+mat_queue_mode.Desc: Change the CPU thread mode. Depending on your settings, it may lead to better performance.
+mat_queue_mode.Name: Change thread mode

2.5: The specified Profile Id {0} does not exist.

ProfileEditPanel.AltEnter自動押下チェックボックス:
Sets whether Alt+Enter is automatically pressed after starting Apex Legends.
Enable this setting to turn off the black bars that occur when the resolution is stretched.
ProfileEditPanel.AltEnter自動押下待機時間ダイヤル:
Sets the time (in seconds) to wait between the start of Apex Legends and the automatic press of Alt+Enter.
Since the time until the title screen is displayed varies depending on your environment, please set it according to your environment.
ProfileEditPanel.AltEnter自動押下方法選択リスト:
Sets the method of executing automatic Alt+Enter presses.
  <Image Recognition>
    Automatically recognizes the display of the title screen and executes the automatic press of Alt + Enter.
    Additional file downloads are required when using this setting. (It will be downloaded automatically.)

  <Time>
    After Apex Legends starts up, it waits for the specified time before executing an automatic Alt+Enter press
    Since the time until the title screen is displayed varies depending on the environment, please set the time according to your environment.
ProfileEditPanel.ApexLegendsパステキスト:
Set the path to the Apex Legends installation (executable file).
Specify the path to "r5apex.exe", not "EasyAntiCheat_launcher.exe".
ProfileEditPanel.ApexLegendsパス自動取得チェックボックス: Automatically retrieve the Apex Legends installation (executable file) installed on this PC.
ProfileEditPanel.ApexLegendsパス自動取得ボタン:
Retrieve the installation location of Apex Legends installed on this PC.
This should be done when the installation location has been changed, such as when reinstalling the software.
ProfileEditPanel.EAappSteam経由IDテキスト: Specify the AppID of the EA app registered with Steam.
ProfileEditPanel.EAappSteam経由チェックボックス:
Sets whether or not the EA app is launched via Steam.
To use this setting, the EA app must be registered with Steam as a non-Steam game.
ProfileEditPanel.カーソルロックチェックボックス:
Enables or disables cursor lock.
If enabled, it prevents the mouse cursor from protruding from the Apex Legends window when multiple monitors are connected.
ProfileEditPanel.システム解像度変更チェックボックス:
Sets whether the system (PC) display resolution should be changed before starting Apex Legends.
Enabling this setting will prevent the PC from freezing for a few seconds every time you switch from one Apex Legends window to another,
for example, by pressing Alt+Tab, This will prevent the PC from freezing for a few seconds.
(Only the main display where Apex Legends is displayed is changed. Sub-displays are not changed)
ProfileEditPanel.ディスプレイスケーリングモードヘルプボタン: Displays a detailed description of the display's scaling mode type.
ProfileEditPanel.ディスプレイスケーリングモード選択リスト: Sets the display scaling mode for resolution changes.
ProfileEditPanel.ディスプレイリフレッシュレートダイヤル: Sets the refresh rate when playing.
ProfileEditPanel.ディスプレイ解像度Hダイヤル: Sets the display resolution (height) when playing.
ProfileEditPanel.ディスプレイ解像度Wダイヤル: Sets the display resolution (width) when playing.
ProfileEditPanel.ディスプレイ設定プリセット有効項目チェックボックス:
When enabled, settings not supported by the display are also displayed in the preset list.
If an unsupported resolution or refresh rate is specified, changing the resolution will fail and the game will not start.
ProfileEditPanel.ディスプレイ設定プリセット選択リスト: When selected, it will be entered automatically.
ProfileEditPanel.フルスクリーンストレッチ有効チェックボックス: Sets whether or not the display resolution is changed (stretched) when playing Apex Legends.
ProfileEditPanel.プラットフォーム選択リスト: Select the platform on which Apex Legends is installed.
ProfileEditPanel.ディスプレイ解像度テストボタン: Tests if it can be displayed normally after changing to the specified display settings.
ProfileEditPanel.コンフィグパネル部品のコンフィグ指定選択リスト: Select the config to load when playing with this profile.
ProfileEditPanel.ビデオコンフィグパネル部品のビデオコンフィグ指定選択リスト: Select the Video config to load when playing with this profile.
ProfileEditPanel.コンフィグパネル部品のコンフィグ読み取り専用チェックボックス: Set whether to make the Config file read-only during play.
ProfileEditPanel.ビデオコンフィグパネル部品のビデオコンフィグ読み取り専用チェックボックス: Set whether to make the Video config file read-only during play.

3.24:
Failed to get Apex Legends install location.

3.25:
<Scaling mode of the display>
- No scaling
  The displayed screen is centered on the display in its original size.
  If the resolution is set to a smaller resolution than that of the display, a black band will be created in the excess area.

- Stretching
  The displayed screen will be scaled to fit the display "without maintaining the aspect ratio".
  Even if the aspect ratio is different, it will be stretched and displayed.
  This setting is recommended when the resolution is stretched.

- Center
  The displayed screen is stretched to fit the display "while maintaining the aspect ratio".
  If the aspect ratio is different, a black band will appear in the excess area.
3.27:
Your display does not support the selected setting {0}×{1}@{2}Hz ({3}).
Are you sure you want to set it?

(If you want to stretch, create a custom resolution in the NVIDIA Control Panel, etc., then try again.)
